resources.string:
"A shattered glass bottle can potentially start a wildfire with help from the sun, which can develop into a forest fire. 
Make sure to always take your garbage home with you!

"

"When using a disposable grill you should always make sure that it is placed on an even and non-flammable surface. 
Make sure that is properly put out, and always dispose of it in a container specifically made for disposable grills. 

"

Did you know that lightning is the cause of a lot of forest fires in Norway every year? 
It can also linger in the ground for three days as well, before igniting. 

Always CALL 110 if you witness any sign of FIRE!

"Using tools that has an open flame, or that potentially sparks can be very dangerous. 
It is important to take precautions when dealing with these kind of tools. 
Always make an assessment before using them, and if there is a danger of forest fire, postpone it! 

"

"Make sure that you always use a container specifically made for disposable grills when you are done using it. 
You can often find a useful map of these on official websites. 

"

In the period from April 15 to September 15, there is a ban on igniting bonfires, barbecue and disposable grill in forest or near forest.When you light a fire, it is ALWAYS important to turn off properly,and make sure it\'s completely off before you move on.Source: norskfriluftsliv.no
I am not translating all this shit to english right now but I hope it will be fixed damn
Descriptive image filling top of page
low danger 0 to 30. Medium danger 31 to 60. great danger over 60
slide to the right to include warning for lower danger index
